p: The survival curve shows that the 30-day mortality of FluA patients was higher than that of FluB-p patients after adjusting for confounders (age, cardiovascular disease, chronic kidney disease, smoking history, confusion, lymphocytes < 0.8 × 10 9/L, hemoglobin < 100 g/L, BUN > 7 mmol/L, arterial pH < 7.35, PO 2/FiO 2 < 300 mmHg, coinfections and systemic corticosteroid use) (Fig. 3).
